humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that the 'Greatest dimension of largest focus of invasion over 0.1 cm: 2 cm' for the invasive mammary carcinoma. Based on the rules provided, T1 tumors are 2 cm or less in size. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T1c.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has an invasive mammary carcinoma that measures 2.0 cm in greatest dimension, which falls under T1c according to the TNM staging system for cancer. This is determined by the measurement of the largest focus of invasion over 0.1 cm, which is 2 cm in this case. The T1 category is for tumors that are 2 cm or less in size. The subcategories T1a, T1b, and T1c are based on size, with T1c being the largest at more than 1 cm but not more than 2 cm. The report also states that the tumor cells are negative for ER, PR, and Her2 by immunohistochemistry, and that the margins are free of tumor. Additionally, there is no lymphovascular invasion identified and no skin present.
